@mitchellnicola Hey Nicola, apologies but Iâ€™m just noticing this tweet. No, disagree entirely. I think migration is a hugely positive force. No nation throughout history has survived by locking out new peopleâ€™s, cultures, or ideas.

I get that FF & FG are frustrated that SF appear to have stolen a march on them by running a presidential candidate- but that doesnâ€™t mean that something as important as Brexit can be used as a political football to bash an opponent. Thatâ€™s highly irresponsible.

I canâ€™t imagine a more unifying force for the Tories- than for SF to engage in such a tactic.
The strength of the Irish position on Brexit as been that itâ€™s a â€˜Green Jersey Campaignâ€™ where we are all singing from the same hymn sheet.

Itâ€™s not difficult to understand that divisions within the Tory party itself, is to the advantage of Ireland with regards to Brexit- so with that in mind, why are some Irish politicians willing 7 SF MPâ€™s to forgoe their abstentionist mandate & take their seats in Westminster 1/2
